intro: Chamaesyce jenningsii, commonly known as the Jennings' sand mat, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Portulacaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It has a compact growth habit with hairy stems and leaves that help reduce water loss. Chamaesyce jenningsii is often found in desert scrub and creosote bush communities.
